Guys, I posted a ticket on the Riot support team and **this did the job!**

Open up Windows Defender Security Center
Go to Device Security > Core Isolation Details
Turn off the Memory Integrity Setting
Disable it, restart your computer, and test out a custom game after

Thank Fancy Teacup and the other Player support specialists if this worked!
Thank you for posting this!  So far, this has been the only fix the has worked for my system.

I had the same problem (running on Windows 10, started after Akali patch, low-mid end PC) and this solved it for me.

1. Open Windows Defender Security Centre
2. Go to Firewall & network protection
3.  Click on Allow an app through firewall
4. Click on Change Settings
5. Look for League of Legends in the list of apps (in my case, there were about 20 of them) and check all the boxes under *Private and Public

*Note: Since I knew I had set my League to only communicate through Private networks, I only checked all the Private boxes. If you're not sure on what you set it as, just check both Private and Public.

Hope this helps! :)
